I'm writing, not because I expect the FS team to work on Gladiator
any time soon (but that would be a dream come true!) but because
if there were to be changes, I'd like to have a say in the improvement
of the game I love.

The most frustrating thing about DOS-based glad is that your
computer-controlled allies insist on being total idiots.  A huge
dilemma for me in playing a game on 'battle' difficulty or above is
that if I leave my team to fend for itself, it usually results in the team
being crushed while the character I control lives and makes semi-
intelligent decisions.

--- story about my woes in certain levels  ---
In fact, I can often do better if I make the
game two player and use the off-player to repeatedly call my guys
back into position while I accomplish some important tasks with
a single other character.  For example, in the first skeleton level
(where the standard game really starts to get a sharp curve in
difficulty, unless you're on skirmish), the tents create fairly strong
skeletons.  A successful run for me usually involves sending a
warrior or thief quickly forward to bust up the tents then regroup.
Usually if I do this I end up returning to a dead team that wandered
out of the safe spot (between trees and water) that I was trying to
keep them in.
--- /story ---

I'd propose being able to toggle an attack stance on characters.
Standstill / defensive / aggressive -- this would allow you to quickly
decide whether your team should run away from danger or stay in
one strategic spot.  Sometimes, as mentioned above, I have to
deliver an inordinate amount of attention to my team of 'reserves'
in order to keep them in a strategically sound place.

Also, I'd propose non-player controlled characters to -not- switch
around their spell; they would use the same spell or skill that the
player left them using.  I'd also add a 'none' switch, so I could keep
my guys from using skills at all when I'm not controlling them.  This
would keep thieves from bombing themselves to death, mages from
teleporting into extreme danger, and clerics from trying to raise
undead when they should be using all they can to heal their team in
the midst of a heated battle.

So yeah.

These seem like simple enough changes to me; if there were to be
another update to the original gladiator game, even, these would
be excellent changes.  It would give a player much greater control
over his team.

Shayd/Chris
